title: Former commercial building in Pittsfield is now a $325K industrial-style home for someone to ‘love’
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: A former commercial building in Pittsfield has been converted into a $325,000 industrial-style home with a 'Love' mural.
The property at 17-19 Linden St. features 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, and includes a two-car garage and a carport.
The house retains original features like exposed brick walls and has modern updates including a kitchen with stainless steel appliances.

title: ‘Every single cage is full’: Nearly 100 cats rescued from Rhode Island hoarding situation
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: 97 cats were rescued from a 1200-square-foot apartment in Woonsocket, Rhode Island by RISPCA.
Some rescued cats are pregnant and have illnesses like colds; they will receive vet care and assessments.
RISPCA is requesting donations for cat supplies and medical expenses via their item wishlist, Venmo, or PayPal.

title: What Jarren Duran said of trade rumors, reps at DH with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jarren Duran acknowledged potential trade rumors but relies on his parents to track them for him.
With an outfield surplus, Duran may see more time as designated hitter for the Red Sox in 2026.
Duran remains committed to contributing wherever needed, emphasizing readiness for any team role.

title: Bruins’ Jordan Harris looking to make hockey more accessible, inclusive in Mass.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jordan Harris launched Harris' Huskies program with SCORE Boston to improve accessibility to hockey for youth in Massachusetts.
SCORE Boston, a Dorchester nonprofit, provides resources like equipment and ice time for children without hockey opportunities.
Harris, 25, has returned to the Bruins' roster following an ankle fracture, participating in five games this season.

title: When will Jayson Tatum return for Celtics? Bill Simmons makes his prediction.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Simmons predicts Jayson Tatum will return to play for the Celtics on March 1 or March 6.
NBC released a docuseries trailer on Tatum, possibly hinting at his return during a March 1 game broadcast.
Tatum participated in a 5-on-5 practice, progressing well in his Achilles injury rehab ahead of schedule.

title: State Police trooper seriously injured after cruiser hit on North Shore highway
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A Massachusetts State Police trooper was seriously injured when his cruiser was hit on I-95 South in Salisbury.
The incident occurred while the trooper removed a ladder from the roadway; both crash participants were hospitalized.
Driver Josue Levi Cuevas Santana, 24, faces charges including negligent operation and failing to move over for emergency vehicles.

title: Fleet goalie Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record, helps Team USA advance to gold-medal game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel achieved three shutouts in the 2026 Winter Olympics, a new record for Olympic women's hockey.
Team USA advances to the gold-medal game after a 5-0 victory against Sweden, with Frankel stopping all 21 shots.
Frankel boasts a .985 save percentage in the Olympics, while Team USA has outscored opponents 36-1 in tournament play.

title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A woman died and her husband is missing after they fell through ice at First Encounter Beach, Eastham.
Rescue teams searched for the missing man using divers, underwater cameras, and drones, but suspended efforts due to darkness.
The couple's distressed dog was found near the site; family members have taken custody of the dog.

title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox traded Rafael Devers to the Giants in June following disagreements over his playing position demands from the team.
Devers resisted moving from third base to DH and refused to cover first base after Triston Casas' injury in May 2025.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner expressed disappointment in Devers' refusal to adapt, describing the situation as "discouraging."

title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Kennedy refuted claims the Red Sox lack passion for winning, emphasizing ownership's commitment to resources.
Rafael Devers' trade stemmed from resolving issues after he was moved from third base to DH due to Alex Bregman.
Alex Bregman signed with the Cubs after Red Sox negotiations stalled; no-trade clause was a key factor.
